predictions.article: Tariffs and Trade Policy Impact on Agriculture
predictions.prediction: The imposition of new tariffs by the Trump administration on Canada and Mexico will lead to a decline in U.S. agricultural exports, particularly affecting soybeans and other key commodities.
U.S. egg prices will increase by more than 40% in 2025 due to supply/demand imbalances and policy impacts.

predictions.article: Stock Market Volatility Due to Tariffs
predictions.prediction: The uncertainty around new tariffs will contribute to continued volatility in the U.S. stock market, particularly affecting sectors like automakers and agriculture.

aiHeadline: March 2025: Tariffs Trigger Economic Turmoil in Agriculture and Markets
aiBlurb: The first week of March 2025 saw significant economic disruptions as new tariffs imposed by the Trump administration led to declines in U.S. agricultural exports, rising egg prices, and increased stock market volatility. These developments underscore the far-reaching impacts of trade policy on the economy.
